meanings.definition: The quality of having strong moral principles; honesty and decency.
meanings.sent1: Her probity shone through when she returned the lost wallet with all the money inside.
meanings.sent2: The community admired his probity as he always stood up for what was right.
meanings.sent3: Even in a game of make-believe, her probity never wavered as she played the role of the noble knight.
meanings.sent4: His probity was a lighthouse in the stormy sea of corruption, guiding others towards honesty.
meanings.sent5: The probity of the old librarian was like a beacon of light, illuminating the path of righteousness for all.

meanings.definition: A person who demonstrates honesty and integrity in their actions.
meanings.sent1: As a probity, he was trusted by all to handle important matters with fairness.
meanings.sent2: The probity of the judge was unquestionable, earning respect from everyone in the courtroom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to imitate the probity of the wise elder, but often ended up in funny situations.
meanings.sent4: She was a probity in a world of deceit, a shining example of truthfulness and honor.
meanings.sent5: In the land of make-believe, the probity was always the hero, saving the day with honesty and integrity.

meanings.definition: The state of being truthful and upright in character.
meanings.sent1: His probity was evident in every word he spoke, never uttering a falsehood.
meanings.sent2: The probity of her actions spoke louder than any words, earning her the trust of all around.
meanings.sent3: Even the mischievous cat seemed to admire the probity of the loyal dog next door.
meanings.sent4: In a world of shadows, his probity was a ray of light, cutting through the darkness of deceit.
meanings.sent5: The probity of the young hero was his greatest weapon, shining brighter than any sword or shield.
